instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage 5V 0.10A
threads.message:
Hello!, have macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which had liquid damage. Replaced damaged and corroded components, device gets 5V 0.10A. Device is detected in DFU mode, tried to revive it but got an error. What could i check next please?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.27V

<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage 5V 0.10A
threads.message:
Corrosion on the backlight circuit is very bad.
Leakage to data lines can easy kill T2, or CPU.

Do you put the machine in DFU with keys combination, or it automatically appears in AC2?

Check diode mode to ground on all coils; including the small ones for SSD.
Compare readings with good board.

threads.title: Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage 5V 0.10A
threads.message: It automatically appears in AC2. Don't have same working board at the moment to compare, but i will check them as soon as i will have one :giggle:
